title: US women’s hockey declines invite to State of the Union, men’s hockey also invited in viral Trump phone call
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: U.S. women's hockey team declined a State of the Union invite due to academic and professional commitments.
The U.S. men's hockey team was also invited after winning gold against Canada, including a White House visit.
Several men's team players expected to attend State of the Union, despite the NHL resuming action Wednesday.

title: Patriots cut running back Antonio Gibson to save cap space
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots release Antonio Gibson, freeing over $3 million in cap space for the 2026 NFL season.
Gibson, recovering from a torn ACL, had no guaranteed money in his final contract year.
New England seeks a new running back; current depth chart includes Rhamondre Stevenson and TreVeyon Henderson.

title: Yes, this storm is officially a blizzard. Here’s what meteorologists want you to know.
author: Heather Alterisio
bullets: Meteorologists declared a blizzard in Massachusetts and Rhode Island, including Boston and Providence, on Monday morning.
Blizzard conditions include heavy or blowing snow reducing visibility to 1/4 mile or less for three hours, with winds of 35 mph.
NWS issued a blizzard warning with winds up to 75 mph, expecting power outages, hazardous travel, and extensive tree damage.

title: Video captures blizzard conditions in downtown Boston
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Photographer Jack Coen captures intense blizzard conditions outside Old State House in downtown Boston with strong gusts and snow.
Snowfall measured about 14 inches in Pawtucket, R.I., and Boston faces nearly whiteout conditions as storm persists.
National Weather Service predicts 18-24 inches of snow in Massachusetts with damaging winds causing significant drifting.

title: Tom Brady’s WWE comments have landed him at the top of Randy Orton’s RKO list
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Randy Orton wants to hit Tom Brady with an RKO following Brady's comments on Logan Paul's podcast.
Tom Brady called WWE 'cute' while discussing the Fanatics Flag Football Classic with Logan Paul.
Brady will play in the Flag Football Classic alongside NFL stars like Saquon Barkley and Rob Gronkowski.

title: These were Monday’s highest reported wind gusts during the storm in Mass.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Wellfleet reported the highest wind gust in Massachusetts during the storm at 83 mph, comparable to a Category 1 hurricane.
Chatham recorded wind gusts up to 77 mph early Monday morning, according to the National Weather Service.
Several locations in Barnstable County experienced wind gusts exceeding 70 mph, contributing to blizzard conditions in the region.

title: LeBron James on Jaylen Brown’s MVP chances: ‘I don’t understand’ why he’s not being talked about
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: LeBron James critiques the lack of recognition for Jaylen Brown's MVP candidacy despite his strong performance this season.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists, placing just outside the top-five in MVP rankings.
The Celtics thrive amidst challenges, ranking second in the Eastern Conference without star Jayson Tatum much of the season.

title: Wachusett delayed opening, ski resorts putting lifts on wind hold
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Wachusett Mountain delayed opening due to a nor'easter; lifts began operating at 11 a.m., two hours later than usual.
Gov. Maura Healey declared a state of emergency as blizzard winds reached 60-70 mph, causing power outages across New England.
Mount Snow and Gunstock also put lifts on wind hold, with operations affected by increased winds across the region.

title: Photo scroll: Blizzard whips across Mass. with heavy snow, high winds
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A strong blizzard hit the Northeast, dumping over 2 feet of snow in parts of Massachusetts on Monday.
Photos capture the snowstorm's impact across Boston, featuring scenes from State Street to Copley Square.
Strong winds caused significant disruption with MBTA buses affected and local residents struggling to clear snow.

title: Market Basket stores in Mass. close early Monday due to the blizzard
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Market Basket closed over 50 Massachusetts stores early at noon Monday due to severe weather conditions.
Several New Hampshire and Rhode Island Market Basket locations were also closed early because of the blizzard.
More than a dozen Market Basket stores in Maine and New Hampshire remained open despite the storm.
